entry.title: Re: LMS Expert! Please guide - Scheduled offerings Question
entry.content:
Hi @anmolacy 

Have you tried the options outlined at https://help.sap.com/docs/successfactors-platform/sap-successfactors-api-reference-guide-odata-v2/getting-classes-with-web-service ?

"You have two ways of getting a class:

  • You know the unique ID of the class and you want to return that single offering. For example, you want to return the January offering for an orientation course.

  • You know the learning item information and you want to return all offerings for that learning item. For example, you know the ID, type, and revision date of an orientation course and you want to see when it is offered."

For a sample on how to make a call based on its specific ID, please check https://help.sap.com/docs/successfactors-platform/sap-successfactors-api-reference-guide-odata-v2/get-scheduled-offering-as-users-or-supervisors

And for a sample on how to call for classes using their item IDs, please check https://help.sap.com/docs/successfactors-learning/sap-successfactors-learning-odata-apis/get-available-scheduled-offerings-sample-call

Best regards,

entry.title: Re: Unable to close project / WBS
entry.content:
Hello @MadhuriTaunk 

This error occurs because the system still detects an open commitment on the WBS, such as a purchase requisition, a purchase order item that isn't fully marked as 'delivery completed' or 'final invoice', a service or limit item, a reservation, or a small GR/IR balance.

Please check Project Control ‚Üí Commitments, then close the related source Manage Purchase Orders. Once the value reaches 0.00, the WBS can be closed. If commitments appear as cleared but the error continues, raise an SAP incident with screenshots (component PS or MM-PUR).

SAP Learning-Controlling Finance Projects

Tracking Commitments on Projects 

Let me know if it helps

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: SAP TRM: Facility Fees on Bilateral Facility 56A
entry.content:
Hello Experts, 

I'm working on setting up a facility in public cloud would appreciate any insights or configuration tips

Context:

  • A bilateral facility (56A) is currently configured with Transaction Type 200 (Obtained).
  • A 3% utilized facility fee is set to be paid quarterly, but the condition data structure reflects "once only", which contradicts the intended frequency.

Objective:

  • Configure the system to calculate and post a 3% fee on the unutilized portion of the facility on a quarterly basis.

Challenges Encountered:

  1. Condition Setup:

    • Update Rule 0 (Manual) results in a single payment date with multiple entries of payment at the end of the facility term.
    • Update Rule 10 (Adjusted for 3 months) causes the Cash Flow tab to remain blank.

  2. Posting to GL:

    • Clarification needed on whether the fee payment will follow standard process flows:
      • Fix, Pay, and Post (TBB1)
      • Automatic Payment Transactions (F111)

Request for Guidance:

  • What is the correct configuration to ensure:
    • Quarterly calculation and posting of the unutilized facility fee?
    • Cash flow visibility for each quarter?
    • GL integration using standard TRM flows?

entry.title: SAP TRM: Loan Structure set up
entry.content:
Hello Experts, 

I'm current working on SAP TRM on Public cloud to set up a loan and appreciate any tips or insights. 

Objective: To configure a loan in SAP TRM where:

  • Interest payments are made quarterly.
  • Principal repayments occur on an irregular (random) schedule.

Key Questions:

  1. Product Type Selection:

    • Can this structure be implemented using Product Type 55A (Interest Rate Instrument)?
    • Or is it necessary to use Product Type 54A (Cash Flow Transaction) to accommodate the irregular principal repayments?

  2. Repayment Method:

    • Given the non-structured nature of the principal repayments, should the Repayment Method be set to Final Repayment?
    • If so, how should interim principal payments be posted in the system?

  3. Balance Calculation:

    • How will SAP TRM track and update the remaining principal balance after each irregular repayment?
    • Will the system automatically adjust the outstanding amount and recalculate interest accordingly?

Request for Guidance:

  • Recommendations on the most appropriate product type and configuration to support this loan structure.
  • Best practices for posting irregular principal payments and ensuring accurate balance tracking.

entry.title: Smart Debugger
entry.content:
Hello everyone. I invented a new Abap debugger ) This is an ABAP Script which can be used like addon to the standard debugger.

The main feature is that  it can work as debugger time machine which store every variables changes on every steps and show it in convenient format. Usuful to analyse deep structures, several tables simultaneously and search changes in the past!

Instance variables, structures and deep structures are shown as  hierarchi—Åal trees so we can have a 'helicopter view' for all variables at any step! Double-click on any table variable or table inside a deep structure will show it in separate window! And we don't have no limitations for windows quantity. If you have a big display you can open more then 10 tables simultaneously and analyse it!

Also it can show mermaid diagram with calls execution or draw execution flow

Stack calls

After double-click on any variable it works as watchpoint and collects not only selected variables but dependents also (forms/methods/functions call). Button "Calculation Flow" will paint all steps in the code where variables were changed and paints Mermaid diagram for it. 

The main profit for me is to getting calculation history quick. As I am an HR developer I tested salary calculations cases. In the classic debugger I can set a watchpoint. But in real program variables names are altered by calls. I name it outer and inners names. And in real debugging I should find manually all that altering to get the origin of all calculations. With Smart Debugger I get calculations history immediately because it can track all that names changes and can collect history path for selected variable by me.

Mermaid version is here.

We can Set/Delete Session/External breakpoints and run standard debug buttons( F5. F6, F7, F8). Also we can get back to the past steps and see variables state at that moment.

So set break-points in any abap code and run. After break-point is triggered, go to the last tab "script" and paste the script. Choose radio button "Execute directly" and press "Start Script" button.

Iterators example

Feel free to open any issue or Idea/requests for changes.

entry.title: Re: Question related to PR and PO.
entry.content:
Hi @winpavan90 ,

please see below my answers to your questions:

1. There is no app for mass creation of purchase requisitions. Instead you can use the existing API. 3411702 - Mass creation of Purchase Requisition

2. Please find here information for setting up email notifications for approvers. How to enable email notifications for pending purchase order approvals?

3. You can create your own conditions using those two BAdIs:

  • SWF_WORKFLOW_CONDITION_DEF
  • SWF_WORKFLOW_CONDITION_EVAL

You can find additional information here: Custom start and step conditions by Business Add-In (BAdI). However, please keep in mind that the PO approval is on header level and the purchase contract is a field on item level. The PO could contain several items, contract items and items without contract.

4. You can exclude agents via BAdI - see here: Exclude restricted agents defined via Business Add-In (BAdI)

In your particular example I would set up three approval steps for all four approvers. For each step set 'Step to be completed by' to 'One of the recipients'.

With the BAdI mentioned above, you can exclude the recipients who gave their approval in a previous step. After each approval step, the approver of that previous step will be eliminated for the next approval steps.

 

best regards,

Marius

entry.title: Impact of a U.S. Federal Government Shutdown on E-Verify
entry.content:
In the event of a U.S. federal government shutdown, certain government-run services may become temporarily unavailable ‚Äî including E-Verify. This will impact how the SuccessFactors Onboarding solutions connect with E-Verify during the shutdown period.

 

What to Expect

  • When attempting to create an E-Verify case during the shutdown, both Onboarding 1.0 and Onboarding will return an error message.

  • Even though the error occurs, an E-Verify process record is still created in the system.

  • Once E-Verify is back online, customers will need to manually resubmit each affected case.

 

What This Means for You

  • Onboarding 1.0 and Onboarding customers will see the same behavior.

  • Cases attempted during the shutdown will not be automatically re-submitted.

  • Manual resubmission is required for each impacted case once the federal systems are restored.

  • Both Onboarding 1.0 and Onboarding may show the E-Verify Cases as "Overdue" but they are not in fact Overdue. All Due Date calculations happen within Onboarding 1.0 and Onboarding and are not generates values of the E-Verify integration.

 

Recommended Action

  • You do not need to monitor the status of your E-Verify cases during the shutdown.

  • After services resume, go into the impacted cases and resubmit them manually to ensure compliance.

 

We will continue to provide updates if the government shutdown occurs and will share reminders when E-Verify services are restored.

entry.title: Re: Can SAP DM Trigger TECO Status?
entry.content:
Good day @Suresh-Eswaran 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at SAP Cloud Integration to SAP Digital Manufacturing , Manufacturing Execution & Custom Fields and Logic BadIs for more details.

To summarise the main points, yes, it is possible to automatically set the TECO status in public cloud after final confirmations from SAP DM. You can enable this through the standard integration scenario SAP_COM_0904. Once the final confirmation is sent from SAP DM with the final flag, S4HANA updates the production order status accordingly.

If you need additional conditional TECO logic, you can use the custom logic app to implement the available BadIs for production order completion.

To validate this, navigate in your public cloud system to the Communications Arrangements app √† activate SAP_COM_0904, and then check the order status in the Manage Production Orders app after you have posted a final confirmation.

I hope this provides the desired insights.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: SAP Public Cloud 2508 / Error during the Migration of...
entry.content:
Hello @LukasKuhn 

Thanks for the clear screenshots.

The problem is in Value Mapping: the S/4HANA Target Value for the Text ID is set to 002 (3 characters). Since the system requires four digits (0002) for the domain TDID, it considers the input invalid during simulation.

What you should do

In the template node General Texts, fill in below

Text Application Object = KNA1

Text ID = 0002

Language (EN) 

Long Text lines

In Migration Cockpit / Value Mapping:

Mapping of Text ID: map your source Buchhaltungsnotiz ‚Üí 0002

Mapping of Text Application Object: target KNA1 uppercase

  • Load texts after the customer header has been created
  • Sanity check: try with Text ID 0001 first; once it posts, switch back to 0002.

No additional customising is required in Public Cloud; this simply involves formatting in the mapping. If you prefer, the A_CustomerText API can also load these notes, but the cockpit will function once 0002 is used.

Let me know if you need further support

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Reclass of non-open item GL Balances
entry.content:
Good day @PatrickNguyen 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at App Extensibility: Display Line Items in General Ledger &  Proposed Reclassification of G/L Account Entries (5AK) for more details.

The issue you are facing happens for a few reasons:

  • First, it important to note that the display line items in General Ledger app applies standard filters automatically.
  • The current API filter you have applied only restricts GLAccount, PostingDate, LedgerGroup, and DocumentType.
  • To get identical results, you must add filters such as IsReversal=false, Ledger=0L, Sourceledger=0L, and companyCode used internally by the app.

I hope this provides the desired insights.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Custom measurement type does not exists in the drop d...
entry.content:
Hello @charlene2 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at Real Estate Rentable Object Replication & Manage Rentable Objects for more details.

To summarise, in Public Cloud, it is not sufficient to just create a measurement type (Z001) in Define Measurement Types. You also need to assign the new type to the relevant usage category. This ensures that it becomes visible in the Manage Rentable Objects app. The following steps will guide you:

  1. Go to the Manage Your Solution app, search for Assign Measurement Types to Usage Categories.
  2. Assign Z001 to the relevant category
  3. Ensure Z001 is not flagged as obsolete in Define Measurement Types.
  4. If required, you can use the Custom Fields and Logic app to make Z001 available in dropdowns for Rentable Objects.

I hope this provides the desired insights.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: The capacity required of production order decreases t...
entry.content:
Hi @nicolasduches 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at Order Confirmations, Production Order Confirmation & Maintaining Parameters for Order Confirmation for more details.

Required capacity should reduce gradually based on confirmed quantities in public cloud. If it drops to 0.00h after the first confirmation as it did in your case, then it usually means that the system interprets your confirmation as a final. You can fix this by:

  • Ensuring Final Confirmation flag is not set to default in your Order Confirmation Parameters.
  • Your operation control key must support partial confirmations and progressive reduction of capacity requirements.
  • When you post confirmations, leave the Final Confirmation checkbox empty unless you intend to close the operation.

After carrying out these checks, partial confirmations will reduce proportionally instead of clearing it to zero.

I hope this provides the desired insights.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Remove free tenant of inetgration suite after upgradi...
entry.content:
Hello
My name is Raquel Souza.
I'm from Brazil and I'll try to help you with this question. I hope it's helpful.

How to remove the free integration package instance after upgrading the plan

What you might have in your subaccount

  1. SAP Integration Suite subscription (SaaS) ‚Äî shows under Instances and Subscriptions.
  2. Cloud Foundry service instances created for it (e.g., Process Integration Runtime / it-rt, API Management, etc.).

You‚Äôll want to clean up both (if they exist).

  1. A) Remove the Integration Suite (Free) subscription

In the BTP cockpit: Subaccount ‚Üí Instances and Subscriptions ‚Üí Integration Suite ‚Üí ‚Ä¶ ‚Üí Unsubscribe.
If you‚Äôre already on the Standard/paid plan, keep only that subscription.

Tip: Plan/entitlement changes for Integration Suite are managed under Entitlements (global account/subaccount). Add the Standard plan and remove the Free one.

  1. B) Delete Cloud Foundry service instances created with the Free plan

Via cockpit

Subaccount ‚Üí Space (CF) ‚Üí Services ‚Üí Instances ‚Üí (‚Ä¶) Delete.

Via CLI (useful if the Delete button fails)

  1. Target the org/space and list services:

cf target -o <ORG> -s <SPACE>

cf services

  1. If applicable, unbind from apps and delete service keys:

cf unbind-service <APP> <SERVICE_INSTANCE_NAME>

cf delete-service-key <SERVICE_INSTANCE_NAME> <KEY_NAME>

  1. Delete the instance:

cf delete-service <SERVICE_INSTANCE_NAME> -f

Note: Process Integration Runtime (it-rt) appears in the marketplace/instances; it‚Äôs common to have an instance with plan api / integration-flow. If it was created under the Free plan, delete it and recreate (or switch to) the instance under your paid plan.

  1. C) Wrap-up (avoid Free leftovers)
  • In Entitlements ‚Üí (Subaccount), remove the Free plan and keep only your current (Standard/Paid) plan.
  • Not every service supports in-place plan changes; when it doesn‚Äôt, delete and recreate is the supported path. Removing instances can be done via cockpit or CF CLI as shown above.

If you tell me exactly what you see under Subscriptions and Service Instances, I can guide you step by step without risking any productive resource.

  1. Target the org/space and list services:

cf target -o <ORG> -s <SPACE>

cf services

  1. If applicable, unbind from apps and delete service keys:

cf unbind-service <APP> <SERVICE_INSTANCE_NAME>

cf delete-service-key <SERVICE_INSTANCE_NAME> <KEY_NAME>

  1. Delete the instance:

cf delete-service <SERVICE_INSTANCE_NAME> -f

Note: Process Integration Runtime (it-rt) appears in the marketplace/instances; it‚Äôs common to have an instance with plan api / integration-flow. If it was created under the Free plan, delete it and recreate (or switch to) the instance under your paid plan.

  1. C) Wrap-up (avoid Free leftovers)
  • In Entitlements ‚Üí (Subaccount), remove the Free plan and keep only your current (Standard/Paid) plan.
  • Not every service supports in-place plan changes; when it doesn‚Äôt, delete and recreate is the supported path. Removing instances can be done via cockpit or CF CLI as shown above.

If you tell me exactly what you see under Subscriptions and Service Instances, I can guide you step by step without risking any productive resource.

entry.title: Re: Modify the BKPF-WWERT field of the accounting entry i...
entry.content:
Hello @Antony_Pantoja 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at Journal Entry, Manage Substitution/Validation Rules & Changing Currency Settings for more details.

To summarise, in public cloud, it is not possible to directly modify conversion date after the journal entry (BKPF-WWERT) is created. Unlike in an on-premise environment, BadIs such as FI_TRANS_DATE_DERIVE are not released in public cloud. The field must be provided correctly during journal entry creation. If your requirement is based on rules, consider checking:

  • Use the Manage Substitution/Validation Rules app
  • Configure Exchange Rate Determination rules to influence which date is picked for exchange rates.
  • Make sure you populate the correct conversion date upfront in your Journal Entry API.

Currency and Exchange Rate Settings in Public Cloud

Custom Fields and Logic

I hope this provides the desired insights.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Packing List form issue in public cloud.
entry.content:
Hi @Mahavir 

Have a look at Form Templates, Set Up Output Parameter Determination   & Handling Unit Item for more details.

To summarise and based on the details you provided, the standard form FDP_PACKING_LIST displays ‚Äú0 EA‚Äù in HU split scenarios because the quantity is taken from the delivery item, which is fully packed and therefore shows zero. To enable you resolve this, you need to adapt the form so that the quantity is pulled from the Handling Unit item level. To achieve this:

  • Open the Maintain Form Templates app √† copy FDP_PACKING_LIST.
  • In your copy, adjust the data binding for Quantity to reference HU Item Quantity instead of Delivery Item Quantity
  • Then save the form an assign it in Output Parameter Determination for Outbound Delivery.

I hope this provides the desired insights.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: aATP - Confirmation Strategies
entry.content:
Hello @AdamHorne 

Have a look at Backorder Processing (BOP) for more details.

If your goal is to treat all customers equally and follow a strict first-come, first-served principle, then the Redistribute strategy is more appropriate than Gain/Improve in public cloud. This is simply because Gain and improve preserve existing confirmations, which can sometimes disadvantage later orders. However, Redistribute considers all orders in the run and reallocates supply fairly across them.

It is important you note that the Redistribute function can reduce already confirmed quantities. Many businesses accept this if fairness is their overriding principle. You have the possibility to refine the behaviour by setting priorities in your Backorder Processing profile. An example could be FIFO by order date, or equal weighting for all customers.

You can achieve this by:

  • Opening the Configure Backorder Processing Profile √† Set confirmation Strategy to Redistribute
  • Then you assign to your plants/DC in your Supply Assignment.
  • Thereafter run the BOP and validate the results across customer orders.

I hope this provides the desired insights.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: while changing the password in sap support portal. Fa...
entry.content:
Hello Bharat,

I understand that you are experiencing difficulties while attempting to change the password on the SAP Support Portal (https://me.sap.com/). If this is the case, you can reset your S-user password by following these steps outlined in KBA 1808560: 

1. Go to Forgot My Password

2. Enter S-user ID S00xxxxxxxx 

3. Click Continue

4.An email will be sent from SAP ID Service (ias@notifications.sap.com) to the email address registered for the user.

5. Locate the email and use the password reset link provided.

Please note that the password reset link is valid for 2 hours from the time it is generated and can only be used once. If the link expires before the password is reset, repeat the steps above.

If you need to update the email address associated with your S-user ID S00xxxxxxx from sapdev@xxxxx.com to purxxx@xxxxx.com, please contact your company‚Äôs Super Administrators, User Administrators, or Cloud Administrators (listed here) . They can make this change in the User Management application, as detailed in KBA 1271545. 

For further guidance, you may also refer to KBA  3108466 - How to update the email address for S-user IDs - SAP for Me

If you have any additional questions or need further clarification, please let me know. I am here to help!

SAP Support

entry.title: Re: Pre-requisite Mandatory for Validation in Finance?
entry.content:
hi @piyush_kr ,

-No, you can create a validation without defining a prerequisite.
In such cases, the validation will always be executed (because there‚Äôs no condition limiting its applicability).
Example: If you want a rule to apply to all postings, you can leave the prerequisite blank.

-When is a prerequisite useful?
When you only want the validation to apply in specific cases (e.g., only for a particular company code, document type, or posting key).
This helps in reducing unnecessary checks and keeps performance optimized.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Re: Investment Boost: A significant step to promote economic growth
entry.content:
Hello @KediaAashish 

Investment boost is a tax incentive and is applicable to all assets purchased on or after 22nd May 2025. Since this is a tax incentive, the keys are assigned to depreciation area 15 and would not have any impact on the depreciation calculation on area 01. For example, if you made further acquisitions on an asset and you want to compute the tax benefit as part of investment boost incentive, you may do so by assigning the relevant keys to depreciation area 15. Hope this clarifies.

entry.title: Data Transfer Tool
entry.content:
With the launch of SAP Sales and Service Cloud V2, a common question arises ‚Äî how do we migrate data from V1 to V2?
SAP addresses this with the Data Transfer Tool, designed to handle standard object data and basic configurations.
Curious to know how it works? Let‚Äôs explore!

Data Transfer Tool

The Data Transfer tool helps transfer object-wise business data and configurations from V1 to V2.
The following scenarios are supported by the Data Transfer tool:

  • Single and Phased Go-Live implementations: 
    The tool facilitates both single and phased go-live approaches, allowing organizations to transition data in stages or all at once, depending on their implementation strategy.
  • Data and Configurations Transfer: It supports the transfer of both data and configuration settings, ensuring that necessary information and system settings are migrated appropriately.
  • Extension fields, Notes, and Attachments: These are supported for transition when mapping is completed by business objects. The scope would vary for different business objects.

How to get access to this feature?

Create a case including your V2 tenant details using the component LOD-LE-MIG-CNS.

Pre-requisites for Data Transfer

  • V2 system should be in an empty state, with no business data or configurations. Few configurations for Cases, Custom Party etc. should be manually created in V2, prior to the data transfer.
  • All prerequisites associated with each object must be fulfilled before proceeding.

Supported Objects

  • Organizational Units
  • Business Partners
  • Business Partner Relationships
  • Identities
  • Sales Territory
  • Product Category Hierarchies
  • Materials
  • Competitor Products
  • Installation Point/Registered Product
  • Registered Product
  • Installed Base
  • Warranty
  • Activities ‚Äì Appointments, Chats, Emails, Phone Calls, Tasks
  • Opportunities
  • Leads
  • Sales Quotes
  • Tickets
  • Communication Systems

**The objects mentioned in this blog reflect the current scope. These may evolve with future SAP updates and enhancements.

General Steps:

  1. Log in to the V1 system using your administrator credentials.
  2. Navigate to:Transition ‚Üí Data Transfer.
  3. Select the required business object from the list.
    Upon selection, the custom extension fields for the object will appear in a separate section at the bottom. Standard fields are automatically included in the data transfer once the object is selected.
  4. Under the Extension Fields tab, enable the checkboxes under the Transfer column for each custom field you wish to include in the data transfer.
  5. (Optional) Perform a Test Data Transfer:
    1. Click Test Data Transfer.
    2. Provide a specific object ID or leave it blank to allow the system to select one at random.
      1.  By default, data for one instance is transferred, including extension fields, business configurations, and code lists.
      2.  To transfer only data, enable the Transfer Only Data switch.
    3. Click OK.
      1.  The selected object‚Äôs settings, configurations, and KUT fields will remain available in the V2 system after test transfer.
  6. To perform the actual data transfer:
    1. Click Transfer Data.
    2. Confirm the action by selecting Yes.
      Once the initial transfer is completed, delta transfer mode is enabled.
      Any updates to the object in V1 will be automatically transferred to V2.
      Note: Updates to settings and configurations are not included in delta transfers and must be manually re-configured in V2.
      The ‚ÄúFinished‚Äù status in the Send Status column indicates that the transfer from V1 is complete. This does not confirm receipt in V2.
      Delta Mode will remain active until Stop Delta is selected. While active, object data updates are transferred automatically - excluding settings and configurations.
      Verify transfer consistency by comparing the values in the Sending Instances and Received Instances columns.
      While these numbers may not be identical (due to filter logic or count variations between systems), they should be reasonably close.
      If you still notice discrepancies, it‚Äôs likely due to differences in how objects are migrated based on their status and other factors. We will cover it in the section 'Object-Wise Details'.
  7. Log in to the V2 system and confirm that the data has been successfully transferred.
    Entities not included in the transfer will appear with empty details.
  8. Initiate Post-Processing:
    Once all transfers are complete, select Start Post-Processing to notify relevant services and begin post-processing activities in the target system.

Data Transfer and Monitoring Options

Data Transfer Tool

Below table explains the various data transfer options available in the Data Transfer Tool:

Option

Purpose

Test Data Transfer

Sends one instance of the object, including the extension fields, business configurations, and code lists. If Transfer Only Data switch is enabled, it excludes the extension fields, business configurations, and code lists of the selected instance.

Transfer Data

Sends all data, including the extension fields, business configurations, and code lists. If a business object‚Äôs status shows Error Occurred, clicking the Transfer Data button again will reprocess only the data packages that encountered errors during the previous transfer.

Stop Delta

Stops automatically sending any new or changed data after the initial load, and applies to all transferred objects.

Start Post-Processing

Starts the final processing for transferred objects after the initial data load, linking related records, updating searches, and activating configurations in the target system.

Extension Fields

Lists the extension fields that are supported for transfer.

Transfer Extension Field Definition

Transfers metadata of the selected extension fields.

Transfer History

Lists the details of multiple transfers initiated by a user.

The following table shows the various monitoring options available in the Data Transfer Tool:

Option

Purpose

Objects

Lists all supported objects.

More Information

Lists object specific documentation links.

Existing Instances

This figure is calculated every night via a job from Readiness Check, i.e. if someone adds new data during the day, it will not be covered

Sending Instances

This represents the number of instances sent to V2. However, it may not match the ‚ÄúExisting Instances‚Äù count because the application applies certain filters before sending to V2. Additionally, not all of these instances may be processed by the application mapper, leading to a mismatch in counts.

Error Sending Instances

This usually means, that the payload for the instance was too big to be sent (e.g. a sales order with thousands of items).

Received Instances

This is the count on V2 side, regardless, if the instances were created via Data Transfer or manually created in V2.

Send Status

It shows the outcome of starting the data transfer process, for example Finished (initiation succeeded) or Error Occurred (initiation failed). This only reflects whether the transfer request was successfully triggered, not whether the data has fully moved from V1 to V2.

Delta Mode

It indicates if automatic updates (delta transfers) are active for a business object after its initial data load. If delta transfers are stopped or need to be restarted for a specific object, it can be done by performing a full load for that object using the Transfer Data button. A green diamond icon indicates that Delta Mode is active for the object. A blank/white diamond icon means Delta Mode is inactive, typically because the initial/full load has not yet been run for that object.

Target Tenant

Lists the target tenant details with the direct link to open them.

Object-Wise Details:

It is recommended to follow the below sequence while transferring the objects.

1. Organizational Units

Points to Note:

  • Marketing Units and Reporting Line Unit functions are not transferred. The Org Unit will get created, but without these functions.
  • Org Unit with only Plant function will be moved into the Plant entity in V2
  • Org Unit with Plant and other functions will be transferred to both Plant and Organizational Unit.
  • Reporting line roles are not automatically transferred and must be manually assigned in V2 later.

2. Business Partners

Points to Note:

  • The Business Partners included in the transition are:
    1. Account
    2. Individual Customers
    3. Contacts
    4. Employees
    5. Competitors
    6. Partners
    7. Partner Contacts
  • Only the extension fields from Business Partner- Common node is supported
  • The number of instances transferred to V2 may not match the count in V1 due to differences in counting logic between the two systems.

3. Business Partner Relationships

Points to Note:

  • Supports the following:
    1. Standard relationship roles (Account-Contact, Employee Responsible)
    2. Custom-defined relationship roles with codes up to 6 characters, provided the corresponding Y-coded values are preconfigured in V2 (i.e., Z-codes in the source system must be created as Y-codes in V2).
    3. Sales area‚Äìdependent relationships (e.g., Partner Functions)
    4. Account team relationships (e.g., current Employee Responsible)
  • Business Partners should be transferred already
  • The number of instances transferred to V2 may not match the count in V1 due to differences in counting logic between the two systems.

4. Identities

Points to Note:

  • Transfers all Business Users and SAP Support Users, along with their user settings (credentials, status, user preferences, etc.) from V1 to V2.
  • Security Policy will not be transferred.
  • Data can be validated in V2 from ‚ÄòAll Settings‚Äô ‚Üí ‚ÄòUsers and Control‚Äô ‚Üí ‚ÄòUsers‚Äô.

5. Sales Territory

Points to Note:

  • Transition includes standard and extension fields from Root node.
  • The connected business objects (Accounts, Employee, Business Partner Relationships, Sales Quotes and Opportunities) should be transitioned successfully either before or after the transition of Sales Territory.
  • Manually maintain the territory rules in V2 later. The ‚ÄòDerive Territory‚Äô action in V2 works only if territory rules are already maintained in V2. If there are no rules maintained, the territory assignments for a transitioned account are deleted while running the derive territory action.

6. Product Category Hierarchies

Points to Note:

  • Product Categories in V1 are referred to as Product Groups in V2.
  • In V2, the concept of Root node is not used. So, the immediate children of the Root becomes the top-level Product Groups
  • ‚ÄòProduct Assignment Allowed‚Äô feature in V1 is not supported in V2.

7. Materials

Points to Note:

  • Extension fields in COMMON and SALES_PROCESS_INFO nodes are supported.
  • All External IDs of a Product can be viewed under Product Details ‚Üí General tab ‚Üí External IDs for Integration
  • Only UoMs with ‚ÄòReleased‚Äô or ‚ÄòIn Preparation‚Äô status are transferred. The ‚ÄòBlocked‚Äô status will not be transferred.

8. Competitor Products

Points to Note:

  • Materials business object must be transitioned before transitioning Competitor Products.
  • Only the extension fields in the COMPETITOR_INFORMATION node of Materials is supported.

9. Installation Point/Registered Product

Points to Note:

  • Installation Point of type Text in V1 will be transitioned as Functional Location in V2
  • Adoption to supports access level restrictions (ACL), Extensions and Attachments are not supported.

10. Registered Product

Points to Note:

  • For transitioning Registered Products from V1 to V2, trigger transition of Registered Product and Installation Point/Registered Product in V1
  • Adoption to supports access level restrictions (ACL), Extensions and Attachments are not supported

11. Installed Base

Points to Note:

  • Extensions are not supported

12. Warranty

Points to Note:

  • Warranty description and duration is supported.

13. Activities

Points to Note:

  • The Data Transition Tool supports the transfer of individual activity types (such as tasks or appointments), but not the overall Activities business object.

a. Appointments

Points to Note:

  • Custom document type is not supported in V2.
  • Involved Parties, Campaigns, Activity Lists are not supported.
  • Only appointments and follow-up opportunities are transitioned for related documents.

b. Chats

Points to Note:

  • The transition of attachments (within a chat) is not supported. However, these attachments can be imported using OData APIs.

c. Emails

Points to Note:

  • Email templates and email channels are not transitioned.
  • The MIME types used to create the email attachments in SAP V1 must be configured and allowed in V2.
  • Except for the inline images added as URLs, all the other inline images are transitioned from SAP Cloud for Customer to SAP Service Cloud Version 2 and SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 as attachments to the email instead of displaying in the email body.
  • The inline images added as URLs would only come up if the corresponding domains are added to the image source under content security policy (CSP). To manage CSP, navigate to User Menu  ‚Üí  Settings  ‚Üí All Settings  ‚Üí System Preferences  ‚Üí Content Security Policy.

d. Phone Calls

Points to Note:

  • All phone calls in ‚ÄòCompleted‚Äô status will be transferred to V2.
  • Outbound Phone calls in ‚ÄòCanceled‚Äô, ‚ÄòOpen‚Äô, ‚ÄòIn Progress‚Äô statuses will be transitioned to V2 as Appointments.
  • Inbound Phone calls in ‚ÄòCanceled‚Äô status will not be transitioned to V2.
  • Inbound Phone Calls in ‚ÄòOpen‚Äô and ‚ÄòIn Progress‚Äô statuses will be transitioned to V2 as ‚ÄòComplete‚Äô
  • Outbound Phone Calls in ‚ÄòOpen‚Äô and ‚ÄòIn Progress‚Äô statuses will be transitioned to V2 as Appointments
  • Any other statuses are not considered for transition
  • Transition of attachments (within a phone call) is not supported. However, attachments can be imported using OData APIs.

e. Tasks

Points to Note:

  • Extension fields are not supported.

14. Opportunities

Points to Note:

  • Extension fields, Attachments, Notes, Approval Information, Competitor and Competitor Products, Employee-based roles in sales teams, Territories, Related Objects etc. are supported.
  • The following Involved Parties are supported:
    • Ship-To
    • Bill-To
    • Payer
    • Partner
    • Partner Contact
  • After migrating opportunities from V1 to V2, the following configuration must be completed in V2:
    • Party Processing Data must be manually maintained under Settings√† Opportunities √† Party Schema. Party Roles will not be visible in the opportunities unless this is completed
    • Define the next Opportunity ID for creation of new opportunity in V2 by navigating to Settings √† Opportunities √† Number Range

15.  Leads

Points to Note:

  • Recommended to transition the Related Objects referenced by Leads (Opportunities, Activities) before initiating the transition of Leads.
  • Only the extension fields at the Root node are supported for transition.
  • Prospects/Accounts/Individual Customer/Contacts with address, Owner, Sales Employees, Sales Unit, Product Items, Notes (except Approval Notes) and Related Objects (with restrictions) are supported for transition.
  • Attachments and Access Control Data are not supported.

16.  Sales Quotes

Points to Note:

  • Sales quotes transitioned from SAP Cloud for Customer to SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 is displayed in read-only mode only and can't be edited.
  • Item Involved Parties, Item notes and attachments, Detail Pricing Information and Document Address are not supported for transition.

17.  Tickets

Points to Note:

  • Tickets are transitioned as Cases in V2.
  • The following configuration should be completed in V2 before transition:
    • Map the Status Dictionary to the Status Schema.
    • Set up the Case Type with the Party Schema and Status Mapping in Service Cloud Version 2.
    • Map the Ticket Type in V1 to the Case Type in V2 by navigating to Navigation Menu ‚Üí Transition ‚Üí Data Transfer (Phased) ‚Üí Document Type Mapping (in V1)
    • Transition the Status and Status Schema configuration objects before transitioning the Tickets object.
  • Internal memo is not supported for transition.
  • Custom Party Roles in the Involved Parties are not supported.
  • Attachments, Tasks, SLA milestones, Related Documents and Service Reference Objects and Extension fields at Root level are supported for transition.
  • Ticket Description will be transitioned as Case Description.
  • Ticket Notes (Internal Comment) will be transitioned to the default note type S000 in Case.

18. Communication Systems

Points to Note:

  • System ID, System Display ID, Host, Status and Created/Changed On and Created/Changed By data are supported for transition.
  • Status of the communication systems would be ‚ÄòInactive‚Äô in V2 after the transition.
  • Any authentication related attributes like Certificates, Users and Passwords are not supported for transition.
  • Systems linked to multiple business systems cannot be fully migrated. In such cases, only the first linked business system will be transferred, and any additional business systems must be set up manually in V2 after migration.

Extension Fields

  • Accounts

  • Opportunity

  • Accounts

  • Individual Customer

Integration Scenarios

  • Once the Communication Systems are transitioned, they would be in an inactive state in V2. It needs to be activated later.
  • Replicating object-wise data ensures ID mapping or document flow for the supported objects.
  • Once the Communication System and the object data are transferred using the Data Transfer Tool, the following configuration should be done in V2:
    • Enter the authentication mechanism in the communication system on V2.
    • Set up Value Mapping in V2.
    • Configure and activate the communication systems. (Refer SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 Integration Guide for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and Integrate SAP Sales Cloud and Service Cloud Version 2 Integration for Master Data with SAP S/4HANA).
    • Disconnect the V1 system from S/4HANA or ECC.
    • Activate the Communication systems and the configurations.

General Points:

  1. Extension fields supported via the Data Transfer Tool is limited to 150 at root level, and 30 for non-root entities. Not all data types are supported. Refer to the section 'Extension Fields' for more details.
  2. Default values of KUT fields are not supported.
  3. Extension scenarios are not supported for transition. It must be manually configured in V2.
  4. Fields of type code with values less than 70 in V1 will be created as static code lists.
  5. Fields of type code with values greater than 70 in V1 will be created as custom code lists in V2. These can be accessed from Settings -> All Settings -> Custom Code Lists. All the custom code lists are created with proxy name in V2 (for example, ExtDFE8DF5129E41FD0889F5E7AE0A0ED2D).
  6. Adaptation Changes, Analytical Content, Mashups, Language Adaptations will not be transitioned.
  7. Transition of Code List Restrictions is not supported and hence should be maintained manually in V2.
  8. The Key Metrics available under Accounts in V2 would reflect only the last 3 months (90 days) data for the activities.
  9. The counts (Existing/Sending/Received Instances) in Data Transfer tool, can only serve as an approximation.

With the basics, key object insights, and monitoring in place, you‚Äôre now equipped to navigate the SAP Data Transfer Tool and manage data migration effectively.

 For future updates, refer to the official SAP documentation: Data Transfer Tool - SAP Help

entry.title: Basic code's of ABAP
entry.content:
This blog consists of Basic code's of ABAP which can help most of the Beginner to understand and use it with simple replacements.....

Content of the post.

  1. Display of Data using REUSE_ALV_GRID
  2. Display of data using Class method and also screen validation error
  3. Modify Table in runtime using REUSE_ALV_GRID_DISPLAY.
  4. Error handling using message class code.
  5. Spool Generation code.
  6. Selection Screen code for visibility of parameters according to requirements.
  7. Excel upload using TEXT_CONVERT_XLS_TO_SAP
  8. Table Maintenance code for Create, display and update data without SM30 and excel upload of data to create data using FM 'ALSM_EXCEL_TO_INTERNAL_TABLE'
  9. Send Mail with Excel and PDF attachments.


1. Display of Data using REUSE_ALV_GRID

REPORT ZASSESSMENT1.

TABLES : BSEG, MARA, MARD.

TYPE-POOLS : SLIS.

*INPUTS
PARAMETERS : R_ACCNO TYPE BSEG-BELNR,
R_FYEAR TYPE BSEG-GJAHR.

*DECLARATIONS OF NEEDED COMPONENTS
DATA : IT_BSEG TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF BSEG,
WA_BSEG TYPE BSEG,
IT_MARA TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF MARA,
WA_MARA TYPE MARA,
IT_MARD TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF MARD,
WA_MARD TYPE MARD.

*CREATING TABLE STRUCTURE FOR FINAL OUTPUT
TYPES : BEGIN OF TY_STRUC,

MATNR TYPE BSEG-MATNR,
BELNR TYPE BSEG-BELNR,
GJAHR TYPE BSEG-GJAHR,
ERNAM TYPE MARA-ERNAM,
AENAM TYPE MARA-AENAM,
LGORT TYPE MARD-LGORT,
END OF TY_STRUC.

DATA : IT_FINAL TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF TY_STRUC,
WA_FINAL TYPE TY_STRUC.

DATA : IT_FIELDCAT TYPE SLIS_T_FIELDCAT_ALV,
WA_FIELDCAT LIKE LINE OF IT_FIELDCAT.

*CONDITION FOR TAKING INPUTS AND ALSO ADDING DATA OF BSEG IN THE INTERNAL TABLE.
IF R_ACCNO IS NOT INITIAL AND R_FYEAR IS NOT INITIAL.

SELECT BELNR MATNR GJAHR FROM BSEG INTO CORRESPONDING FIELDS OF TABLE IT_BSEG WHERE BELNR = R_ACCNO AND GJAHR = R_FYEAR.

ELSEIF R_ACCNO IS NOT INITIAL AND R_FYEAR IS INITIAL.

SELECT BELNR MATNR GJAHR FROM BSEG INTO CORRESPONDING FIELDS OF TABLE IT_BSEG WHERE BELNR = R_ACCNO.

ELSEIF R_ACCNO IS INITIAL AND R_FYEAR IS NOT INITIAL.

SELECT BELNR MATNR GJAHR FROM BSEG INTO CORRESPONDING FIELDS OF TABLE IT_BSEG WHERE GJAHR = R_FYEAR.

ELSEIF R_ACCNO IS INITIAL AND R_FYEAR IS INITIAL.

SELECT BELNR MATNR GJAHR FROM BSEG INTO CORRESPONDING FIELDS OF TABLE IT_BSEG.

ENDIF.

*DELETING THE DUPLICATES WITH RESPECT TO MATNR
*DELETE ADJACENT DUPLICATES FROM IT_BSEG COMPARING MATNR.

*NOW ADDING CONTENT OF MARA AND MARD INTO THE INTERNAL TABLE RESPECTIVELY USING MATNR AS FOREIGN KEY
SELECT MATNR ERNAM AENAM FROM MARA INTO CORRESPONDING FIELDS OF TABLE IT_MARA FOR ALL ENTRIES IN IT_BSEG WHERE MATNR = IT_BSEG-MATNR.

SELECT MATNR LGORT FROM MARD INTO CORRESPONDING FIELDS OF TABLE IT_MARD FOR ALL ENTRIES IN IT_MARA WHERE MATNR = IT_MARA-MATNR.

*MERGING ALL THE DATA INTO FINAL INTERNAL TABLE
LOOP AT IT_BSEG INTO WA_BSEG.

READ TABLE IT_MARA INTO WA_MARA WITH KEY MATNR = WA_BSEG-MATNR .

READ TABLE IT_MARD INTO WA_MARD WITH KEY MATNR = WA_MARA-MATNR.

WA_FINAL-MATNR = WA_MARA-MATNR.
WA_FINAL-BELNR = WA_BSEG-BELNR.
WA_FINAL-GJAHR = WA_BSEG-GJAHR.
WA_FINAL-ERNAM = WA_MARA-ERNAM.
WA_FINAL-AENAM = WA_MARA-AENAM.
WA_FINAL-LGORT = WA_MARD-LGORT.

APPEND WA_FINAL TO IT_FINAL.

ENDLOOP.

*DELETING THE DUPLICATES WITH RESPECT TO MATNR
DELETE ADJACENT DUPLICATES FROM IT_FINAL COMPARING MATNR.

WA_FIELDCAT-FIELDNAME = 'MATNR'.
WA_FIELDCAT-SELTEXT_M = 'MATERIAL NUMBER'.
WA_FIELDCAT-OUTPUTLEN = '18'.
APPEND WA_FIELDCAT TO IT_FIELDCAT.
CLEAR WA_FIELDCAT.

WA_FIELDCAT-FIELDNAME = 'BELNR'.
WA_FIELDCAT-SELTEXT_M = 'ACCOUNT DOCUMENT NUMBER'.
WA_FIELDCAT-OUTPUTLEN = '10'.
APPEND WA_FIELDCAT TO IT_FIELDCAT.
CLEAR WA_FIELDCAT.

WA_FIELDCAT-FIELDNAME = 'GJAHR'.
WA_FIELDCAT-SELTEXT_M = 'FISCAL YEAR'.
WA_FIELDCAT-OUTPUTLEN = '4'.
APPEND WA_FIELDCAT TO IT_FIELDCAT.
CLEAR WA_FIELDCAT.

WA_FIELDCAT-FIELDNAME = 'ERNAM'.
WA_FIELDCAT-SELTEXT_M = 'CREATED BY'.
WA_FIELDCAT-OUTPUTLEN = '12'.
APPEND WA_FIELDCAT TO IT_FIELDCAT.
CLEAR WA_FIELDCAT.

WA_FIELDCAT-FIELDNAME = 'AENAM'.
WA_FIELDCAT-SELTEXT_M = 'CHANGED BY'.
WA_FIELDCAT-OUTPUTLEN = '12'.
APPEND WA_FIELDCAT TO IT_FIELDCAT.
CLEAR WA_FIELDCAT.

WA_FIELDCAT-FIELDNAME = 'LGORT'.
WA_FIELDCAT-SELTEXT_M = 'STORAGE LOCATION'.
WA_FIELDCAT-OUTPUTLEN = '4'.
APPEND WA_FIELDCAT TO IT_FIELDCAT.
CLEAR WA_FIELDCAT.




CALL FUNCTION 'REUSE_ALV_GRID_DISPLAY'
EXPORTING
IT_FIELDCAT = IT_FIELDCAT
TABLES
T_OUTTAB = IT_FINAL
* EXCEPTIONS
* PROGRAM_ERROR = 1
* OTHERS = 2
.
IF SY-SUBRC <> 0.
* MESSAGE ID SY-MSGID TYPE SY-MSGTY NUMBER SY-MSGNO
* WITH SY-MSGV1 SY-MSGV2 SY-MSGV3 SY-MSGV4.
ENDIF.


2. Display of data using Class method and also screen validation error

REPORT ZASSESSMENT2.

PARAMETERS : EMP_ID TYPE PA0000-PERNR.

DATA: WA_PA00 TYPE PA0000,
WA_PA2 TYPE PA0002.

AT SELECTION-SCREEN .

SELECT SINGLE * FROM PA0000 INTO WA_PA00 WHERE PERNR = EMP_ID.
SELECT SINGLE * FROM PA0002 INTO WA_PA2 WHERE PERNR = WA_PA00-PERNR.

IF WA_PA2-PERNR IS INITIAL.
MESSAGE 'EMPLOYEE NOT PRESENT' TYPE 'E'.

ENDIF.

CLASS EMP_MAIN DEFINITION.
PUBLIC SECTION.
METHODS : GET_DATA,
DISPLAY.

PRIVATE SECTION.
DATA: IT_PA02 TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF PA0002,
WA_PA02 TYPE PA0002.


TYPES: BEGIN OF TY_STRUC,
EMP_ID TYPE PA0002-PERNR,
LAST_NAME TYPE PA0002-NACHN,
FIRST_NAME TYPE PA0002-VORNA,
DOB TYPE PA0002-GBDAT,
GENDER TYPE ZGENDER,

END OF TY_STRUC.


DATA : IT_ANS TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF TY_STRUC,
WA_ANS TYPE TY_STRUC.

ENDCLASS.

CLASS EMP_MAIN IMPLEMENTATION.
METHOD GET_DATA.


SELECT PERNR NACHN VORNA GBDAT GESCH FROM PA0002 INTO CORRESPONDING FIELDS OF TABLE ME->IT_PA02 WHERE PERNR = EMP_ID.

LOOP AT ME->IT_PA02 INTO ME->WA_PA02.
ME->WA_ANS-EMP_ID = ME->WA_PA02-PERNR.
ME->WA_ANS-LAST_NAME = ME->WA_PA02-NACHN.
ME->WA_ANS-FIRST_NAME = ME->WA_PA02-VORNA.
ME->WA_ANS-DOB = ME->WA_PA02-GBDAT.

IF ME->WA_PA02-GESCH = 1.
ME->WA_ANS-GENDER = 'M-YES'.
ELSE.
ME->WA_ANS-GENDER = 'F-YES'.
ENDIF.

APPEND ME->WA_ANS TO ME->IT_ANS.

ENDLOOP.

ENDMETHOD.

METHOD DISPLAY.
DATA : LR_TABLE TYPE REF TO CL_SALV_TABLE.
CL_SALV_TABLE=>FACTORY( IMPORTING R_SALV_TABLE = LR_TABLE
CHANGING T_TABLE = ME->IT_ANS ).
LR_TABLE->DISPLAY( ).
ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

START-OF-SELECTION.

DATA LR_MAIN TYPE REF TO EMP_MAIN.

CREATE OBJECT LR_MAIN.
LR_MAIN->GET_DATA( ).

LR_MAIN->DISPLAY( ).


3. Modify Table in runtime using REUSE_ALV_GRID_DISPLAY.

REPORT ZASSESSMENT3.

DATA WA_MS TYPE ZMATERIAL_SALES.

TYPE-POOLS : SLIS.

SELECT-OPTIONS: DATE FOR WA_MS-C_DATE.

DATA: IT_SO TYPE TABLE OF ZMATERIAL_SALES,
IT_CY TYPE TABLE OF ZMATERIAL_SALES,
WA_SO TYPE ZMATERIAL_SALES,
WA_CY TYPE ZMATERIAL_SALES.


DATA : IT_FIELDCAT TYPE SLIS_T_FIELDCAT_ALV,
WA_FIELDCAT LIKE LINE OF IT_FIELDCAT.

START-OF-SELECTION.

IF DATE IS NOT INITIAL.
PERFORM FETCH USING DATE[] CHANGING IT_SO.
ELSE.
SELECT * FROM ZMATERIAL_SALES INTO TABLE IT_SO.
ENDIF.

IT_CY = IT_SO.

PERFORM FIELD_CATALOG.



CALL FUNCTION 'REUSE_ALV_GRID_DISPLAY'
EXPORTING
I_CALLBACK_PROGRAM = SY-REPID
I_CALLBACK_USER_COMMAND = 'SAVE'
IT_FIELDCAT = IT_FIELDCAT
TABLES
T_OUTTAB = IT_SO
EXCEPTIONS
PROGRAM_ERROR = 1
OTHERS = 2
.
IF SY-SUBRC <> 0.
* MESSAGE ID SY-MSGID TYPE SY-MSGTY NUMBER SY-MSGNO
* WITH SY-MSGV1 SY-MSGV2 SY-MSGV3 SY-MSGV4.
ENDIF.



FORM FETCH USING P_DATE LIKE DATE[]
CHANGING P_IT_SO LIKE IT_SO.
SELECT * FROM ZMATERIAL_SALES INTO TABLE P_IT_SO WHERE C_DATE IN P_DATE.

ENDFORM. " FETCH




FORM FIELD_CATALOG .

WA_FIELDCAT-COL_POS = 1.
WA_FIELDCAT-FIELDNAME = 'MATNR'.
WA_FIELDCAT-SELTEXT_M = 'Material no.'.
WA_FIELDCAT-OUTPUTLEN = '18'.
WA_FIELDCAT-KEY = 'X'.
APPEND WA_FIELDCAT TO IT_FIELDCAT.
CLEAR WA_FIELDCAT.

WA_FIELDCAT-COL_POS = 2.
WA_FIELDCAT-FIELDNAME = 'VBELN'.
WA_FIELDCAT-SELTEXT_M = 'Sales Doc no.'.
WA_FIELDCAT-OUTPUTLEN = '10'.
WA_FIELDCAT-KEY = 'X'.
APPEND WA_FIELDCAT TO IT_FIELDCAT.
CLEAR WA_FIELDCAT.

WA_FIELDCAT-COL_POS = 3.
WA_FIELDCAT-FIELDNAME = 'MAT_DESC'.
WA_FIELDCAT-SELTEXT_M = 'Material Discription'.
WA_FIELDCAT-OUTPUTLEN = '40'.
WA_FIELDCAT-EDIT = 'X'.
APPEND WA_FIELDCAT TO IT_FIELDCAT.
CLEAR WA_FIELDCAT.

WA_FIELDCAT-COL_POS = 4.
WA_FIELDCAT-FIELDNAME = 'SAL_DESC'.
WA_FIELDCAT-SELTEXT_M = 'Sales DiscrIption'.
WA_FIELDCAT-OUTPUTLEN = '40'.
WA_FIELDCAT-EDIT = 'X'.
APPEND WA_FIELDCAT TO IT_FIELDCAT.
CLEAR WA_FIELDCAT.

WA_FIELDCAT-COL_POS = 5.
WA_FIELDCAT-FIELDNAME = 'QUANT'.
WA_FIELDCAT-SELTEXT_M = 'Quantity'.
WA_FIELDCAT-OUTPUTLEN = '12'.
WA_FIELDCAT-EDIT = 'X'.
APPEND WA_FIELDCAT TO IT_FIELDCAT.
CLEAR WA_FIELDCAT.

WA_FIELDCAT-COL_POS = 6.
WA_FIELDCAT-FIELDNAME = 'PRICE'.
WA_FIELDCAT-SELTEXT_M = 'Price'.
WA_FIELDCAT-OUTPUTLEN = '4'.
APPEND WA_FIELDCAT TO IT_FIELDCAT.
CLEAR WA_FIELDCAT.

WA_FIELDCAT-COL_POS = 7.
WA_FIELDCAT-FIELDNAME = 'C_DATE'.
WA_FIELDCAT-SELTEXT_M = 'Date Of Creation'.
WA_FIELDCAT-OUTPUTLEN = '8'.
APPEND WA_FIELDCAT TO IT_FIELDCAT.
CLEAR WA_FIELDCAT.

ENDFORM.


FORM SAVE USING RCOMM TYPE SY-UCOMM
SEL TYPE SLIS_SELFIELD.

CASE SY-UCOMM.
WHEN '&DATA_SAVE'.
LOOP AT IT_SO INTO WA_SO.
CLEAR WA_CY.
READ TABLE IT_CY INTO WA_CY INDEX SY-TABIX.

IF WA_SO NE WA_CY.
WA_CY-MAT_DESC = WA_SO-MAT_DESC.
WA_CY-SAL_DESC = WA_SO-SAL_DESC.
WA_CY-QUANT = WA_SO-QUANT.

MODIFY ZMATERIAL_SALES FROM WA_CY.

IF SY-SUBRC = 0.
MESSAGE 'RECORD HAS BEEN SAVED SUCCESSFULY' TYPE 'S'.
ENDIF.
ENDIF.

CLEAR WA_SO.
ENDLOOP.

ENDCASE.
ENDFORM.

4. Error handling using message class code.

Firstly create msg class using se91 Tcode and then we can use in our code

REPORT ZASSESSMENT4.

TABLES: BSEG,MSEG.

PARAMETERS C_CODE TYPE BSEG-BUKRS.

TYPES: BEGIN OF TY_BM,
BUKRS TYPE BSEG-BUKRS,
GJAHR TYPE BSEG-GJAHR,
MATNR TYPE BSEG-MATNR,
BELNR TYPE BSEG-BELNR,
MBLNR TYPE MSEG-MBLNR,
ZEILE TYPE MSEG-ZEILE,
END OF TY_BM.

DATA: IT_BM TYPE TABLE OF TY_BM,
WA_BM TYPE TY_BM.

DATA: IT_MSEG TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF MSEG,
WA_MSEG TYPE MSEG.

DATA: IT_BSEG TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF BSEG,
WA_BSEG TYPE BSEG.

DATA OBJ TYPE REF TO ZCX_K_ERRORHANDLE.

AT SELECTION-SCREEN.
TRY.
IF C_CODE IS NOT INITIAL.
SELECT GJAHR MATNR BELNR BUKRS FROM BSEG INTO CORRESPONDING FIELDS OF TABLE IT_BSEG WHERE BUKRS = C_CODE.

IF IT_BSEG IS NOT INITIAL.
SELECT MBLNR ZEILE FROM MSEG INTO CORRESPONDING FIELDS OF TABLE IT_MSEG FOR ALL ENTRIES IN IT_BSEG WHERE MBLNR = IT_BSEG-BELNR.
ENDIF.

IF IT_MSEG IS INITIAL.
RAISE EXCEPTION TYPE ZCX_K_ERRORHANDLE
EXPORTING
TEXTID = ZCX_K_ERRORHANDLE=>ZCX_K_ERRORHANDLE.
ENDIF.
ELSE.
RAISE EXCEPTION TYPE ZCX_K_ERRORHANDLE
EXPORTING
TEXTID = ZCX_K_ERRORHANDLE=>INPUT_ERROR.
ENDIF.

CATCH ZCX_K_ERRORHANDLE INTO OBJ.

MESSAGE OBJ TYPE 'E'.

ENDTRY.



CLASS LCL_MAIN DEFINITION.
PUBLIC SECTION.
METHODS : DISPLAY.


ENDCLASS.

CLASS LCL_MAIN IMPLEMENTATION.

METHOD DISPLAY.
DATA : LR_TABLE TYPE REF TO CL_SALV_TABLE.
CL_SALV_TABLE=>FACTORY( IMPORTING R_SALV_TABLE = LR_TABLE
CHANGING T_TABLE = IT_BM ).
LR_TABLE->DISPLAY( ).
ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

START-OF-SELECTION.

LOOP AT IT_BSEG INTO WA_BSEG.
READ TABLE IT_MSEG INTO WA_MSEG WITH KEY MBLNR = WA_BSEG-BELNR.

WA_BM-MATNR = WA_BSEG-MATNR.
WA_BM-BUKRS = WA_BSEG-BUKRS.
WA_BM-GJAHR = WA_BSEG-GJAHR.
WA_BM-BELNR = WA_BSEG-BELNR.
WA_BM-MBLNR = WA_MSEG-MBLNR.
WA_BM-ZEILE = WA_MSEG-ZEILE.
APPEND WA_BM TO IT_BM.
CLEAR WA_BM.

ENDLOOP.

DATA LR_MAIN TYPE REF TO LCL_MAIN.

CREATE OBJECT LR_MAIN.

LR_MAIN->DISPLAY( ).


5. Spool Generation code.

REPORT ZASSESSMENT5.

DATA: IT_MS LIKE ZMATERIAL_SALES OCCURS 0 WITH HEADER LINE,
C_DATE LIKE ZMATERIAL_SALES-C_DATE.

DATA: IT_SP LIKE ZSPOOLTABLE OCCURS 0 WITH HEADER LINE.

DATA: GD_SPOOL_NR LIKE TSP01-RQIDENT.

START-OF-SELECTION.

SELECT C_DATE FROM ZMATERIAL_SALES INTO CORRESPONDING FIELDS OF TABLE IT_MS.

DELETE ADJACENT DUPLICATES FROM IT_MS COMPARING C_DATE.

LOOP AT IT_MS.

CLEAR: C_DATE.

C_DATE = IT_MS-C_DATE.

WAIT UP TO 1 SECONDS.


PERFORM SUBMIT_PROGRAM.
PERFORM GET_SPOOL_NUMBER.
PERFORM ADD_SPOOL_NUMBER.

ENDLOOP.



FORM SUBMIT_PROGRAM .

SUBMIT ZASSESSMENT3 WITH DATE = C_DATE
TO SAP-SPOOL
WITHOUT SPOOL DYNPRO
AND RETURN.


ENDFORM. " SUBMIT_PROGRAM



FORM GET_SPOOL_NUMBER .

CLEAR GD_SPOOL_NR.
SELECT SINGLE RQIDENT INTO GD_SPOOL_NR FROM TSP01
WHERE RQCRETIME = ( SELECT MAX( RQCRETIME ) FROM TSP01 WHERE RQCLIENT = SY-MANDT
AND RQOWNER = SY-UNAME ).




ENDFORM. " GET_SPOOL_NUMBER



FORM ADD_SPOOL_NUMBER .

IT_SP-C_DATE = C_DATE.
IT_SP-SPOOL_NO = GD_SPOOL_NR.

APPEND IT_SP.

MODIFY ZSPOOLTABLE FROM IT_SP.
COMMIT WORK.

ENDFORM. " ADD_SPOOL_NUMBER


6. Selection Screen code for visibility of parameters according to requirements.

REPORT ZASSESSMENT7.

INCLUDE ZSELECTION_SCREEN.


**&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
**& Include ZSELECTION_SCREEN
**&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*DATA: BELNR TYPE BSEG-BELNR,
* GJAHR TYPE BSEG-GJAHR,
* BUKRS TYPE BSEG-BUKRS.
*
*SELECTION-SCREEN BEGIN OF BLOCK B1 WITH FRAME TITLE TEXT-001.
* SELECT-OPTIONS: ACC_NO FOR BELNR NO INTERVALS NO-EXTENSION,
* F_YEAR FOR GJAHR MODIF ID P1 NO INTERVALS NO-EXTENSION,
* C_CODE FOR BUKRS MODIF ID P2 NO INTERVALS NO-EXTENSION.
*
* SELECTION-SCREEN SKIP 1.
*
* SELECTION-SCREEN BEGIN OF LINE.
*
*
* PARAMETERS C1 RADIOBUTTON GROUP RAD1 USER-COMMAND R1 DEFAULT 'X'.
* SELECTION-SCREEN COMMENT 3(26) TEXT-021.
* SELECTION-SCREEN POSITION 30.
* PARAMETERS C2 RADIOBUTTON GROUP RAD1.
* SELECTION-SCREEN COMMENT 32(29) TEXT-022.
* SELECTION-SCREEN END OF LINE.
*
* SELECTION-SCREEN SKIP 1.
*
* SELECTION-SCREEN BEGIN OF BLOCK B2 WITH FRAME TITLE TEXT-002.
* PARAMETERS: V2 AS CHECKBOX MODIF ID VW USER-COMMAND COMM2.
* PARAMETERS: V3 AS CHECKBOX MODIF ID VW USER-COMMAND COMM2.
* PARAMETERS: V4 AS CHECKBOX MODIF ID VW USER-COMMAND COMM2.
* SELECTION-SCREEN END OF BLOCK B2.
*
*SELECTION-SCREEN BEGIN OF BLOCK B3 WITH FRAME TITLE TEXT-003.
* PARAMETERS: V5 AS CHECKBOX MODIF ID VW1.
*
* SELECTION-SCREEN END OF BLOCK B3.
*
* SELECTION-SCREEN END OF BLOCK B1.




AT SELECTION-SCREEN OUTPUT.

IF C1 = 'X'.
SET CURSOR FIELD 'C2'.
LOOP AT SCREEN.
IF SCREEN-GROUP1 = 'VW1'.
SCREEN-ACTIVE = '0'.

MODIFY SCREEN.
ENDIF.


IF V4 = 'X' AND ( V3 = 'X' OR V2 = 'X') .

IF SCREEN-GROUP1 = 'P2'.
SCREEN-ACTIVE = '0'.
MODIFY SCREEN.

ENDIF.
IF SCREEN-GROUP1 = 'P1'.
SCREEN-ACTIVE = '1'.
MODIFY SCREEN.
ENDIF.


ELSEIF V4 = 'X'.

IF SCREEN-GROUP1 = 'P1'.
SCREEN-ACTIVE = '0'.
MODIFY SCREEN.

ENDIF.
IF SCREEN-GROUP1 = 'P2'.
SCREEN-ACTIVE = '1'.
MODIFY SCREEN.

ENDIF.
ELSE.

IF SCREEN-GROUP1 = 'P2'.
SCREEN-ACTIVE = '0'.
MODIFY SCREEN.

ENDIF.
ENDIF.
ENDLOOP.

ENDIF.

IF C2 = 'X'.
SET CURSOR FIELD 'C1'.
LOOP AT SCREEN.
IF SCREEN-GROUP1 = 'VW'.
SCREEN-ACTIVE = '0'.
MODIFY SCREEN.
ENDIF.

IF SCREEN-GROUP1 = 'P2'.
SCREEN-ACTIVE = '0'.
MODIFY SCREEN.
ENDIF.

ENDLOOP.
ENDIF.

8. Table Maintenance code for Create, display and update data without SM30 and excel upload of data to create data using FM 'ALSM_EXCEL_TO_INTERNAL_TABLE'

REPORT ztable_update.

TYPES : BEGIN OF ty_ztable,
sel TYPE char1.
INCLUDE STRUCTURE ztable.
TYPES : END OF ty_ztable.

DATA : gs_ztable TYPE ty_ztable,
gt_file_data TYPE TABLE OF ztable,
gob_table TYPE REF TO cl_salv_table,
gt_ztable1 TYPE TABLE OF ztable,
gt_ztable TYPE TABLE OF ty_ztable,
gs_zzpp_ztable TYPE ztable,
gv_mark TYPE char01,
gv_field1 TYPE ztable-field1,
gv_field2 TYPE ztable-field2,
gv_field3 TYPE ztable-field3,
gt_excel TYPE TABLE OF alsmex_tabline.

DATA: gs_excel TYPE ole2_object, " Excel object
gs_mapl TYPE ole2_object, " list of workbooks
gs_map TYPE ole2_object, " workbook
gs_zl TYPE ole2_object, " cell
gs_f TYPE ole2_object, " font
gs_column TYPE ole2_object. " Column

CONTROLS: t_tab TYPE TABLEVIEW USING SCREEN 9000.

SELECTION-SCREEN BEGIN OF BLOCK b2 WITH FRAME TITLE TEXT-501.
PARAMETERS : p_rb1 RADIOBUTTON GROUP grp1 DEFAULT 'X' USER-COMMAND usr1 MODIF ID r1,
p_rb2 RADIOBUTTON GROUP grp1 MODIF ID r1,
p_rb3 RADIOBUTTON GROUP grp1 MODIF ID r1.


SELECTION-SCREEN BEGIN OF BLOCK t11 WITH FRAME TITLE TEXT-502.
PARAMETERS : p_file1 TYPE rlgrap-filename MODIF ID z1.
SELECTION-SCREEN: BEGIN OF LINE,
PUSHBUTTON 1(24) TEXT-105 USER-COMMAND form MODIF ID z1,
END OF LINE.
SELECTION-SCREEN END OF BLOCK t11.


SELECTION-SCREEN BEGIN OF BLOCK t12 WITH FRAME TITLE TEXT-503.
SELECT-OPTIONS :so_pc1 FOR gv_field1 NO-EXTENSION NO INTERVALS MODIF ID z2 ,
so_fpc1 FOR gv_field3 NO-EXTENSION NO INTERVALS MODIF ID z2 ,
so_cc1 FOR gv_field2 NO-EXTENSION NO INTERVALS MODIF ID z2 .
SELECTION-SCREEN END OF BLOCK t12.

SELECTION-SCREEN BEGIN OF BLOCK t13 WITH FRAME TITLE TEXT-504.
SELECT-OPTIONS : so_pc2 FOR gv_field1 NO-EXTENSION NO INTERVALS MODIF ID z3,
so_fpc2 FOR gv_field3 NO-EXTENSION NO INTERVALS MODIF ID z3,
so_cc2 FOR gv_field2 NO-EXTENSION NO INTERVALS MODIF ID z3.
SELECTION-SCREEN END OF BLOCK t13.
SELECTION-SCREEN END OF BLOCK b2.

SELECTION-SCREEN BEGIN OF SCREEN 500 AS WINDOW.
SELECTION-SCREEN BEGIN OF BLOCK b3 WITH FRAME TITLE TEXT-008 .

SELECTION-SCREEN BEGIN OF LINE.
* YES
PARAMETERS p_y RADIOBUTTON GROUP rad2 USER-COMMAND r1 DEFAULT 'X'.
SELECTION-SCREEN COMMENT 3(10) TEXT-027.
SELECTION-SCREEN POSITION 15.
* NO
PARAMETERS p_n RADIOBUTTON GROUP rad2.
SELECTION-SCREEN COMMENT 18(10) TEXT-028.
SELECTION-SCREEN END OF LINE.
SELECTION-SCREEN END OF BLOCK b3.
SELECTION-SCREEN END OF SCREEN 500.

AT SELECTION-SCREEN.
IF sy-ucomm EQ 'FORM'.
PERFORM download_format.
ENDIF.

AT SELECTION-SCREEN ON VALUE-REQUEST FOR p_file1.
PERFORM f4_filename USING p_file1.

AT SELECTION-SCREEN ON VALUE-REQUEST FOR so_pc1-low.
PERFORM Param_F4_help_pc USING so_pc1-low.

AT SELECTION-SCREEN ON VALUE-REQUEST FOR so_fpc1-low.
PERFORM Param_F4_help_fpc USING so_fpc1-low.

AT SELECTION-SCREEN ON VALUE-REQUEST FOR so_cc1-low.
PERFORM Param_F4_help_cc USING so_cc1-low.

AT SELECTION-SCREEN ON VALUE-REQUEST FOR so_pc2-low.
PERFORM Param_F4_help_pc USING so_pc2-low.

AT SELECTION-SCREEN ON VALUE-REQUEST FOR so_fpc2-low.
PERFORM Param_F4_help_fpc USING so_fpc2-low.

AT SELECTION-SCREEN ON VALUE-REQUEST FOR so_cc2-low.
PERFORM Param_F4_help_cc USING so_cc2-low.

AT SELECTION-SCREEN OUTPUT.
LOOP AT SCREEN.
IF screen-group1 = 'Z1'.
screen-active = COND #( WHEN p_rb1 = 'X' THEN 1
WHEN p_rb2 = 'X' THEN 0
WHEN p_rb3 = 'X' THEN 0 ).
ENDIF.
IF screen-group1 = 'Z2'.
screen-active = COND #( WHEN p_rb1 = 'X' THEN 0
WHEN p_rb2 = 'X' THEN 1
WHEN p_rb3 = 'X' THEN 0 ).
ENDIF.
IF screen-group1 = 'Z3'.
screen-active = COND #( WHEN p_rb1 = 'X' THEN 0
WHEN p_rb2 = 'X' THEN 0
WHEN p_rb3 = 'X' THEN 1 ).
ENDIF.

IF screen-group1 = 'V0' .
screen-active = 0.
ENDIF.
IF screen-group1 = 'V1' .
screen-active = 0.
ENDIF.
IF screen-group1 = 'V2' .
screen-active = 0.
ENDIF.
IF screen-group1 = 'V3' .
screen-active = 0.
ENDIF.
IF screen-group1 = 'C0' .
screen-active = 0.
ENDIF.
IF screen-group1 = 'C1' .
screen-active = 0.
ENDIF.
IF screen-group1 = 'C2' .
screen-active = 0.
ENDIF.
IF screen-group1 = 'C3' .
screen-active = 0.
ENDIF.
MODIFY SCREEN.
ENDLOOP.

START-OF-SELECTION.
IF p_rb1 = 'X'.
PERFORM Create_data.

ELSEIF p_rb2 = 'X'.
PERFORM Update_data.

ELSEIF p_rb3 = 'X'.
PERFORM Display_data.
ENDIF.

END-OF-SELECTION.

FORM Create_data .

DATA: ls_temp_data TYPE ztable,
lt_temp_tab TYPE TABLE OF ztable,
lv_cont TYPE char1.

IF p_file1 IS NOT INITIAL.
IF ( p_file1 CP '*xls' OR p_file1 CP '*xlsx' ).
TRY.
CALL FUNCTION 'ALSM_EXCEL_TO_INTERNAL_TABLE'
EXPORTING
filename = p_file1
i_begin_col = 1
i_begin_row = 2
i_end_col = '30'
i_end_row = '999999'
TABLES
intern = gt_excel
EXCEPTIONS
inconsistent_parameters = 1
upload_ole = 2
OTHERS = 3.
IF sy-subrc <> 0.
MESSAGE 'Excel File Conversion Error' TYPE 'S' DISPLAY LIKE 'E'.
EXIT.
ENDIF.
CATCH cx_root INTO DATA(lob_oref).
MESSAGE lob_oref->get_text( ) TYPE 'S' DISPLAY LIKE 'E'.
ENDTRY.

LOOP AT gt_excel ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<lfs_excel>).
IF ls_temp_data-field1 IS NOT INITIAL
AND ls_temp_data-field3 IS NOT INITIAL
AND ls_temp_data-field2 IS NOT INITIAL
AND <lfs_excel>-col <> 1
AND line_exists( lt_temp_tab[ field1 = ls_temp_data-field1
field3 = ls_temp_data-field3
field2 = ls_temp_data-field2 ] ).
MESSAGE |Duplicate Entry found in Excel at Row number : | && |{ <lfs_excel>-row + 1 }| TYPE 'S' DISPLAY LIKE 'E'.
LEAVE LIST-PROCESSING.
ENDIF.
CASE <lfs_excel>-col.
WHEN 1.
CLEAR ls_temp_data.
ls_temp_data-field1 = <lfs_excel>-value.
CONDENSE ls_temp_data-field1.
WHEN 2.
ls_temp_data-field3 = <lfs_excel>-value.
CONDENSE ls_temp_data-field3.
WHEN 3.
ls_temp_data-field2 = <lfs_excel>-value.
CONDENSE ls_temp_data-field2.
ENDCASE.
AT END OF row.
ls_temp_data-client = sy-mandt.
APPEND ls_temp_data TO lt_temp_tab.
ENDAT.
ENDLOOP.
ENDIF.

IF lt_temp_tab IS NOT INITIAL.
DELETE FROM ztable.
IF sy-subrc = 0.
COMMIT WORK.
ELSE.
ROLLBACK WORK.
ENDIF.
INSERT ztable FROM TABLE lt_temp_tab .
IF sy-subrc = 0.
COMMIT WORK.
MESSAGE 'Data inserted successfully' TYPE 'S'.
ELSE.
ROLLBACK WORK.
MESSAGE 'Data not inserted' TYPE 'S' DISPLAY LIKE 'E'.
ENDIF.
ELSE.
MESSAGE 'Entry already exists' TYPE 'S' DISPLAY LIKE 'E'.
ENDIF.
ENDIF.

ENDFORM.


FORM Update_data .

SELECT *
FROM ztable
INTO CORRESPONDING FIELDS OF TABLE @gt_ztable
WHERE field1 IN _pc1
AND field3 IN _fpc1
AND field2 IN _cc1.

IF gt_ztable IS NOT INITIAL.
CALL SCREEN 9000.
ELSE.
MESSAGE 'No Data Found' TYPE 'S' DISPLAY LIKE 'E'.
ENDIF.
ENDFORM.


FORM Display_data .

SELECT *
FROM ztable
INTO TABLE (lt_ztable)
WHERE field1 IN _pc2
AND field3 IN _fpc2
AND field2 IN _cc2.

IF lt_ztable IS NOT INITIAL.
TRY.
CALL METHOD cl_salv_table=>factory
IMPORTING
r_salv_table = gob_table
CHANGING
t_table = lt_ztable.
CATCH cx_salv_msg .
ENDTRY.
CALL METHOD gob_table->display.
ELSE.
MESSAGE 'No data found' TYPE 'S' DISPLAY LIKE 'E'.
LEAVE LIST-PROCESSING.
ENDIF.
ENDFORM.


FORM download_format .

CREATE OBJECT gs_excel 'EXCEL.APPLICATION'.
SET PROPERTY OF gs_excel 'Visible' = 1.
* get list of workbooks, initially empty
CALL METHOD OF
gs_excel
'Workbooks' = gs_mapl.
PERFORM err_hdl.

* add a new workbook
CALL METHOD OF
gs_mapl
'Add' = gs_map.
PERFORM err_hdl.

* Output column headings to active Excel sheet
PERFORM fill_cell USING 1 1 1 'Field 1' .
PERFORM fill_cell USING 1 2 1 'Field 2' .
PERFORM fill_cell USING 1 3 1 'Field 3' .

CALL METHOD OF
gs_excel
'Columns' = gs_column.

CALL METHOD OF
gs_column
'Autofit'.

CALL METHOD OF
gs_excel
'Worksheets' = gs_mapl.
PERFORM err_hdl.

SET PROPERTY OF gs_map 'NAME' = 'COPY'.

FREE OBJECT: gs_excel,
gs_mapl,
gs_map,
gs_zl,
gs_f,
gs_column.


ENDFORM.



FORM f4_filename USING p_file.
TRY.
CALL FUNCTION 'F4_FILENAME'
EXPORTING
field_name = 'P_FILE '
IMPORTING
file_name = p_file.
CATCH cx_root INTO DATA(lob_oref).
MESSAGE lob_oref->get_text( ) TYPE 'S' DISPLAY LIKE 'E'.
ENDTRY.

ENDFORM.

FORM Param_F4_help_pc USING
p_so_pc.
DATA: lt_return TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ddshretval.

SELECT DISTINCT field1
FROM ztable
INTO TABLE (lt_value).

TRY.
CALL FUNCTION 'F4IF_INT_TABLE_VALUE_REQUEST'
EXPORTING
retfield = 'field1'
value_org = 'S'
TABLES
value_tab = lt_value
return_tab = lt_return
EXCEPTIONS
parameter_error = 1
no_values_found = 2
OTHERS = 3.
CATCH cx_root INTO DATA(lob_oref).
MESSAGE lob_oref->get_text( ) TYPE 'S' DISPLAY LIKE 'E'.
ENDTRY.

READ TABLE lt_return INTO DATA(ls_return) INDEX 1.
IF sy-subrc = 0.
p_so_pc = ls_return-fieldval.
ENDIF.
ENDFORM.

FORM Param_F4_help_Fpc USING
p_so_Fpc.
DATA: lt_return TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ddshretval.

SELECT DISTINCT field3
FROM ztable
INTO TABLE (lt_value).
TRY.
CALL FUNCTION 'F4IF_INT_TABLE_VALUE_REQUEST'
EXPORTING
retfield = 'field3'
value_org = 'S'
TABLES
value_tab = lt_value
return_tab = lt_return
EXCEPTIONS
parameter_error = 1
no_values_found = 2
OTHERS = 3.
CATCH cx_root INTO DATA(lob_oref).
MESSAGE lob_oref->get_text( ) TYPE 'S' DISPLAY LIKE 'E'.
ENDTRY.
READ TABLE lt_return INTO DATA(ls_return) INDEX 1.
IF sy-subrc = 0.
p_so_fpc = ls_return-fieldval.
ENDIF.
ENDFORM.

FORM Param_F4_help_cc USING
p_so_cc.
DATA: lt_return TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ddshretval.

SELECT DISTINCT field2
FROM ztable
INTO TABLE (lt_value).
TRY.
CALL FUNCTION 'F4IF_INT_TABLE_VALUE_REQUEST'
EXPORTING
retfield = 'field2'
value_org = 'S'
TABLES
value_tab = lt_value
return_tab = lt_return
EXCEPTIONS
parameter_error = 1
no_values_found = 2
OTHERS = 3.
CATCH cx_root INTO DATA(lob_oref).
MESSAGE lob_oref->get_text( ) TYPE 'S' DISPLAY LIKE 'E'.
ENDTRY.
READ TABLE lt_return INTO DATA(ls_return) INDEX 1.
IF sy-subrc = 0.
p_so_cc = ls_return-fieldval.
ENDIF.
ENDFORM.


FORM err_hdl .
IF sy-subrc <> 0.
MESSAGE 'Worksheet not created' TYPE 'S' DISPLAY LIKE 'E'.
STOP.
ENDIF.
ENDFORM.


FORM fill_cell USING i TYPE any
j TYPE any
bold TYPE any
val TYPE any.
CALL METHOD OF
gs_excel
'Cells' = gs_zl
EXPORTING
#1 = i
#2 = j.

PERFORM err_hdl.
SET PROPERTY OF gs_zl 'Value' = val.
PERFORM err_hdl.
GET PROPERTY OF gs_zl 'Font' = gs_f.
PERFORM err_hdl.
SET PROPERTY OF gs_f 'Bold' = bold.
PERFORM err_hdl.

ENDFORM.


MODULE status_9000 OUTPUT.
SET PF-STATUS 'PF_STATUS_9000'.
SET TITLEBAR 'TITLE1'.
ENDMODULE.


MODULE user_command_9000 INPUT.
CASE sy-ucomm.
WHEN 'BACK'.
LEAVE TO SCREEN 0.
WHEN 'CANCEL' OR 'EXIT'.
LEAVE PROGRAM.
WHEN 'SAVE'.
MOVE-CORRESPONDING gt_ztable TO gt_ztable1.
LOOP AT gt_ztable1 ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<gfs_zrm>).
<gfs_zrm>-client = sy-mandt.
ENDLOOP.
UPDATE ztable FROM TABLE gt_ztable1.
IF sy-subrc = 0.
COMMIT WORK.
MESSAGE 'Data updated successfully' TYPE 'S'.
ELSE.
ROLLBACK WORK.
MESSAGE 'Data not updated ' TYPE 'S'.
ENDIF.
WHEN '%DEL'.
IF line_exists( gt_ztable[ sel = 'X' ] ).
CALL SELECTION-SCREEN 500 STARTING AT 5 5.
IF sy-subrc = 0.
IF p_y = 'X'.
gt_ztable1 = VALUE #( FOR gs_z IN gt_ztable
WHERE ( sel = 'X' )
( CORRESPONDING #( gs_z ) ) ).
IF gt_ztable1 IS NOT INITIAL.
DELETE ztable FROM TABLE gt_ztable1 .
IF sy-subrc = 0.
COMMIT WORK.
DELETE gt_ztable WHERE sel = 'X'.
MESSAGE 'Selected Data deleted' TYPE 'S'.
ELSE.
ROLLBACK WORK.
MESSAGE 'Data not deleted' TYPE 'S'.
ENDIF.
ENDIF.
ENDIF.
ENDIF.
ELSE.
MESSAGE 'Select Data' TYPE 'S' DISPLAY LIKE 'E'.
ENDIF.

WHEN '%SEL'. "Select all
gs_ztable-sel = 'X'.
MODIFY gt_ztable FROM gs_ztable TRANSPORTING sel WHERE sel <> 'X'.

WHEN '%DSE'. "Deselect ALl
gs_ztable-sel = ' '.
MODIFY gt_ztable FROM gs_ztable TRANSPORTING sel WHERE sel = 'X'.

ENDCASE.
ENDMODULE.


MODULE t_tab_change_tc_attr OUTPUT.
DESCRIBE TABLE gt_ztable LINES t_tab-lines.
ENDMODULE.

MODULE t_tab_modify INPUT.
MODIFY gt_ztable
FROM gs_ztable
INDEX t_tab-current_line.
ENDMODULE.
Flow Logic - Screen 9000

PROCESS BEFORE OUTPUT.
MODULE t_tab_change_tc_attr.

LOOP AT gt_ztable
INTO gs_ztable
WITH CONTROL t_tab
CURSOR t_tab-current_line.
ENDLOOP.


MODULE status_9000.
*
PROCESS AFTER INPUT.
LOOP AT gt_ztable.
CHAIN.
FIELD gs_ztable-sel.
FIELD gs_ztable-field1.
FIELD gs_ztable-field2.
FIELD gs_ztable-field3.
MODULE t_tab_modify ON CHAIN-REQUEST.
ENDCHAIN.
ENDLOOP.

MODULE user_command_9000.

9. Send Mail with Excel and PDF attachments.

data declarations...

         V_LINES_BIN LIKE SY-TABIX,
         WA_DOC_CHNG LIKE SODOCCHGI1.

         TAB_CLASS LIKE SCLASS .

  DATA : LV_SUBJECT(50) TYPE C.
  DATA :  LV_SUBJ_FILE   TYPE SO_OBJ_DES .
  DATA : LT_ATT_HEAD    TYPE SOLI_TAB.
  DATA : LV_FILENAME    TYPE STRING.
  DATA : LV_TEXT_LINE    TYPE SOLI.
  DATA : CONTENT TYPE STRING.
  DATA : VAL TYPE STRING.

  DATA : GD_SPOOL_NR LIKE TSP01-RQIDENT,
         GD_BYTECOUNT LIKE TST01-DSIZE.

  DATA : IT_CONTENTS TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF SOLISTI1,
         WA_CONTENTS TYPE SOLISTI1.

* EXCEL
  DATA : MT_FCAT        TYPE LVC_T_FCAT,
         MT_DATA        TYPE REF TO DATA,
         M_FLAVOUR      TYPE STRING,
         M_VERSION      TYPE STRING,
         MO_RESULT_DATA TYPE REF TO CL_SALV_EX_RESULT_DATA_TABLE,
         MO_COLUMNS     TYPE REF TO CL_SALV_COLUMNS_TABLE,
         MO_AGGREG      TYPE REF TO CL_SALV_AGGREGATIONS,
         MO_SALV_TABLE  TYPE REF TO CL_SALV_TABLE,
         M_FILE_TYPE    TYPE SALV_BS_CONSTANT.
  FIELD-SYMBOLS : <TAB> TYPE ANY TABLE.

I. Create Excel

GET REFERENCE OF IT_EXCEL INTO mt_data. "IT_EXCEL consists of data which need to in excel

*if we didn't pass fieldcatalog we need to create it
  ASSIGN mt_data->* TO <tab>.
  TRY .
      cl_salv_table=>factory(
      EXPORTING
      list_display = abap_false
      IMPORTING
      r_salv_table = mo_salv_table
      CHANGING
      t_table      = <tab> ).
    CATCH cx_salv_msg.

  ENDTRY.

  "get colums & aggregation infor to create fieldcat
  mo_columns  = mo_salv_table->get_columns( ).
  mo_aggreg   = mo_salv_table->get_aggregations( ).
  mt_fcat     =  cl_salv_controller_metadata=>get_lvc_fieldcatalog(
    r_columns      = mo_columns
    r_aggregations = mo_aggreg ).

  IF cl_salv_bs_a_xml_base=>get_version( ) EQ
  if_salv_bs_xml=>version_25 OR
  cl_salv_bs_a_xml_base=>get_version( ) EQ
  if_salv_bs_xml=>version_26.



    mo_result_data = cl_salv_ex_util=>factory_result_data_table(
    r_data                      = mt_data
*        s_layout                    = is_layout
    t_fieldcatalog              = mt_fcat
*        t_sort                      = it_sort
*        t_filter                    = it_filt
    ).

    CASE cl_salv_bs_a_xml_base=>get_version( ).
      WHEN if_salv_bs_xml=>version_25.
        m_version = if_salv_bs_xml=>version_25.
      WHEN if_salv_bs_xml=>version_26.
        m_version = if_salv_bs_xml=>version_26.
    ENDCASE.

    m_file_type = if_salv_bs_xml=>C_TYPE_EXCEL_XML.

    m_flavour = if_salv_bs_c_tt=>c_tt_xml_flavour_export.


    "transformation of data to excel
    CALL METHOD cl_salv_bs_tt_util=>if_salv_bs_tt_util~transform
      EXPORTING
        xml_type      = m_file_type
        xml_version   = m_version
        r_result_data = mo_result_data
        xml_flavour   = m_flavour
        gui_type      = if_salv_bs_xml=>c_gui_type_gui
      IMPORTING
        xml           = g_xstring.
  ENDIF.


  CALL METHOD cl_bcs_convert=>xstring_to_solix
    EXPORTING
      iv_xstring = g_xstring
    RECEIVING
      et_solix   = binary_content.

II. Create PDF

*for fetching print parameters and then changing according to file format
  CALL FUNCTION 'GET_PRINT_PARAMETERS'
    EXPORTING
      NO_DIALOG      = 'X'
    IMPORTING
      OUT_PARAMETERS = MSTR_PRINT_PARMS.

  MSTR_PRINT_PARMS-PAART = 'X_65_230'.

*Submit ZProgram whose output should be the content need to be in PDF
*for creating spool
  SUBMIT ZPROGRAM  WITH C_CODE = C_CODE
                          WITH C_NAME = C_NAME
  TO SAP-SPOOL
   SPOOL PARAMETERS MSTR_PRINT_PARMS
   WITHOUT SPOOL DYNPRO
   AND RETURN.

  CLEAR GD_SPOOL_NR.

*fetching spool id
  SELECT SINGLE RQIDENT INTO GD_SPOOL_NR  FROM TSP01
        WHERE RQCRETIME = ( SELECT MAX( RQCRETIME ) FROM TSP01 WHERE RQCLIENT = SY-MANDT
      AND RQOWNER = SY-UNAME ).

*converting spool content into pdf
  CLEAR :GD_BYTECOUNT .
  CALL FUNCTION 'CONVERT_ABAPSPOOLJOB_2_PDF'
    EXPORTING
      SRC_SPOOLID              = GD_SPOOL_NR
      NO_DIALOG                = ' '
    IMPORTING
      PDF_BYTECOUNT            = GD_BYTECOUNT
    TABLES
      PDF                      = PDF_OUTPUT
    EXCEPTIONS
      ERR_NO_ABAP_SPOOLJOB     = 1
      ERR_NO_SPOOLJOB          = 2
      ERR_NO_PERMISSION        = 3
      ERR_CONV_NOT_POSSIBLE    = 4
      ERR_BAD_DESTDEVICE       = 5
      USER_CANCELLED           = 6
      ERR_SPOOLERROR           = 7
      ERR_TEMSEERROR           = 8
      ERR_BTCJOB_OPEN_FAILED   = 9
      ERR_BTCJOB_SUBMIT_FAILED = 10
      ERR_BTCJOB_CLOSE_FAILED  = 11
      OTHERS                   = 12.

  IF sy-subrc <> 0.
    MESSAGE ID sy-msgid TYPE sy-msgty NUMBER sy-msgno
    WITH sy-msgv1 sy-msgv2 sy-msgv3 sy-msgv4.
  ENDIF.

* convert attachment
  CALL FUNCTION 'SX_TABLE_LINE_WIDTH_CHANGE'
    TABLES
      CONTENT_IN  = PDF_OUTPUT
      CONTENT_OUT = SOLI_TAB
    EXCEPTIONS
      OTHERS      = 4.

  IF sy-subrc <> 0.
    MESSAGE ID sy-msgid TYPE sy-msgty NUMBER sy-msgno
    WITH sy-msgv1 sy-msgv2 sy-msgv3 sy-msgv4.
  ENDIF.

  CALL FUNCTION 'SCMS_BINARY_TO_XSTRING'
    EXPORTING
      INPUT_LENGTH = GD_BYTECOUNT
    IMPORTING
      BUFFER       = E_XSTRING
    TABLES
      BINARY_TAB   = SOLI_TAB
    EXCEPTIONS
      OTHERS       = 2.

  IF sy-subrc <> 0.
    MESSAGE ID sy-msgid TYPE sy-msgty NUMBER sy-msgno
    WITH sy-msgv1 sy-msgv2 sy-msgv3 sy-msgv4.
  ENDIF.

  LT_SOLIX = CL_DOCUMENT_BCS=>XSTRING_TO_SOLIX( IP_XSTRING = E_XSTRING ).
"LT_SOLIX is the string format of pdf which is use in attachment of mail

III. Send Mail

Try.
* create persistent send request
      SEND_REQUEST = CL_BCS=>CREATE_PERSISTENT( ).

* create and set document
      CLEAR: TEXT, TEXT[], CONTENT, LV_SUBJECT.

* Email Subject
      CLEAR: LV_SUBJECT.

        LV_SUBJECT =  'Subject of the mail.'.

      CLEAR: LV_SUBJ_FILE.
        lV_SUBJ_FILE = 'File_name'

* Body
      CLEAR : IT_CONTENTS[].

  "email body
  WA_CONTENTS-LINE = 'Greetings,'.
  APPEND WA_CONTENTS TO IT_CONTENTS.
  CLEAR : WA_CONTENTS.

  WA_CONTENTS-LINE = 'This is the mail body'.
  APPEND WA_CONTENTS TO IT_CONTENTS.
  CLEAR : WA_CONTENTS.
  
  APPEND WA_CONTENTS TO IT_CONTENTS.
  WA_CONTENTS-LINE = 'Thanks'.
  APPEND WA_CONTENTS TO IT_CONTENTS.
  CLEAR : WA_CONTENTS.
  
      DOCUMENT = CL_DOCUMENT_BCS=>CREATE_DOCUMENT(
      I_TYPE = 'HTM'
      I_TEXT = IT_CONTENTS
      I_SUBJECT = LV_SUBJECT ).

* add document to send request
      CALL METHOD SEND_REQUEST->SET_DOCUMENT( DOCUMENT ).

** add attachment for pdf
      TRY.
          CALL METHOD DOCUMENT->ADD_ATTACHMENT
            EXPORTING
              I_ATTACHMENT_TYPE    = 'PDF'
              I_ATTACHMENT_SUBJECT = LV_SUBJ_FILE
              I_ATT_CONTENT_HEX    = LT_SOLIX.
        CATCH cx_document_bcs.
      ENDTRY.


* add attachment for excel

      TRY.
          CALL METHOD DOCUMENT->ADD_ATTACHMENT(
            i_attachment_type = 'XLS'
            i_attachment_subject = LV_SUBJ_FILE
            i_att_content_hex = binary_content ).
        CATCH cx_document_bcs.
      ENDTRY.


      data : MAIL_TO  TYPE AD_SMTPADR.

    
* create recipient (e-mail address)

            CLEAR: MAIL_TO.
            MAIL_TO = 'abc@xyz.com'.

            RECIPIENT = CL_CAM_ADDRESS_BCS=>CREATE_INTERNET_ADDRESS(
            MAIL_TO ).


*   add recipient with its respective attributes to send request
            CALL METHOD SEND_REQUEST->ADD_RECIPIENT
              EXPORTING
                I_RECIPIENT = RECIPIENT
                I_EXPRESS   = 'X'.
*            i_copy      = 'X'.

* If wants to add CC mail id
            CLEAR: MAIL_TO.
            MAIL_TO = 'cc@xyz.com'.


            RECIPIENT = CL_CAM_ADDRESS_BCS=>CREATE_INTERNET_ADDRESS(
            MAIL_TO ).


*   add recipient with its respective attributes to send request
            CALL METHOD SEND_REQUEST->ADD_RECIPIENT
              EXPORTING
                I_RECIPIENT = RECIPIENT
*            I_EXPRESS   = 'X'.
                i_copy      = 'X'.
         

* send document
      CALL METHOD SEND_REQUEST->SEND(
      EXPORTING
      I_WITH_ERROR_SCREEN = 'X'
      RECEIVING
      RESULT = SENT_TO_ALL ).

      COMMIT WORK.

      MESSAGE 'Mail Send Successfully' TYPE 'S'.

      DATA:   BCS_EXCEPTION TYPE REF TO CX_BCS.

    CATCH CX_BCS INTO BCS_EXCEPTION.
      MESSAGE 'Mail Not sent' TYPE 'E'.


  ENDTRY.
